intro: Aegopogon argentinus, commonly known as the Argentine goatweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas and is often found in disturbed soils. It has a taproot system and produces small, dry fruits that are dispersed by wind. Aegopogon argentinus is an herbaceous perennial that can reach heights of up to 60 cm.
